The K-nearest algorithm is a learning method based on states, so it doesn’t want a learning stage. It treats with the training pattern that is related to a distance function and the choice of the class function based on the classes of the nearest neighbors [ 41, 42]. When a new pattern is classified, it must be compared to others using a similarity measure taking into consideration the k-neighbors. The distance between the new pattern and the neighbor is used as the weight [ 47–49]. The most prevalent method to measure this distance is Euclidean. To measure the Euclidean distance between two vectors p i and p j, the equation mentioned in [ 50] will be used:
